techs.name: Environmentalism
techs.quote: 'Earth provides enough to satisfy every man's need, but not every man's greed' - Mohandas Gandhi

techs.name: Telecommunications
techs.quote: 'The more we elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.' - J.B. Priestly

techs.name: Mobile Tactics
techs.quote: 'Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power, we have guided missiles and misguided men.' â€“ Martin Luther King Jr.

techs.name: Robotics
techs.quote: '1. A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm. 2. A robot must obey any orders given to it by human beings, except when such orders would conflict with the First Law. 3. A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Law.' - Isaac Asimov

techs.name: Lasers
techs.quote: 'The night is far spent, the day is at hand; let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.' - The Holy Bible: Romans, 13:12

techs.name: Satellites
techs.quote: 'Now, somehow, in some new way, the sky seemed almost alien.' - Lyndon B. Johnson

techs.name: Advanced Ballistics
techs.quote: 'Once the rockets are up, who cares where they come down?' - Tom Hehrer

techs.name: Globalization
techs.quote: 'The new electronic interdependence recreates the world in the image of a global village.' - Marshall McLuhan

techs.name: The Internet
techs.quote: 'The Internet is becoming the town square for the global village of tomorrow' - Bill Gates

techs.name: Particle Physics
techs.quote: 'Every particle of matter is attracted by or gravitates to every other particle of matter with a force inversely proportional to the squares of their distances.' - Isaac Newton

techs.name: Stealth
techs.quote: 'Be extremely subtle, even to the point of formlessness. Be extremely mysterious, even to the point of soundlessness. Thereby you can be the director of the opponent's fate.' - Sun Tzu

techs.name: Cloning
techs.quote: 'Better a soulless clone... than a souled roach.' - David Mitchell

techs.name: Memetics
techs.quote: 'Memes, the DNA of the soul.' - Monsoon, Metal Gear Rising

techs.name: Distributed Computing
techs.quote: 'I think computer viruses should count as life ... I think it says something about human nature that the only form of life we have created so far is purely destructive. We've created life in our own image' - Stephen Hawking

techs.name: Nanomaterials
techs.quote: 'Nanomachines, son!' - Senator Armstrong, Metal Gear Rising

techs.name: Artificial Environments
techs.quote: 'The marks humans leave are too often scars.' - John Green

techs.name: Ecotheory
techs.quote: 'Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company.' - Benjamin Franklin Wade

techs.name: Cognitive Technology
techs.quote: 'Everything you can imagine is real.' - Pablo Picasso

techs.name: Microscale Engineering
techs.quote: 'Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.' - Rumi

techs.name: Orbital Development
techs.quote: 'We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.' - Oscar Wilde

techs.name: Transgenics
techs.quote: 'The era of the transgenic chicken is quietly dawning, coming soon to your bathroom medicine cabinet.' - Andrew Lawler

techs.name: Neural Interface
techs.quote: 'Why should you believe your eyes? You were given eyes to see with, not to believe with. Your eyes can see the mirage, the hallucination as easily as the actual scenery.' - Ward Moore

techs.name: Autonomous Systems
techs.quote: 'We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done.' - Alan Turing

techs.name: Nuclear Fusion
techs.quote: 'The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has merely made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Arcologies
techs.quote: 'We should throw away our arcologies and our starships, and live like the Lord intended' - Peter F. Hamilton

techs.name: Designer Lifeforms
techs.quote: 'Yeah, yeah, but your scientists were so preoccupied with whether or not they could that they didn't stop to think if they should.' - Dr Ian Malcom, Jurassic Park

techs.name: Biomodification
techs.quote: 'If it could be demonstrated that any complex organ existed, which could not possibly have been formed by numerous, successive, slight modifications, my theory would absolutely break down. But I can find no such case.' - Charles Darwin

techs.name: Cybernetics
techs.quote: 'It would be possible to describe everything scientifically, but it would make no sense; it would be without meaning, as if you described a Beethoven symphony as a variation of wave pressure.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Artificial Intelligence
techs.quote: 'I love mankind ... it's people I can't stand!!' - Charles M. Schulz

techs.name: Nanotechnology
techs.quote: 'The impact of nanotechnology is expected to exceed the impact the electronics revolution has had on our lives. - Richard Schwartz

techs.name: Adamantium
techs.quote: 'We are as indestructible as we believe ourselves to be.' - John Green

techs.name: Terraforming
techs.quote: 'I am sorry you have to live in the time of terraforming, and not in the spring that follows.' - Annalee Newitz

techs.name: Human Augmentation
techs.quote: 'It's not the machines you need to fear. It's the people. Other people. The augmented men and women that will come afterwards.' - Dave Pryor

techs.name: Digital Society
techs.quote: 'Reality is chaos, and weâ€™ve created an algorithm that keeps us informed of as much of that chaos as possible, from the second we wake up to the second we go to bed, and then we wonder why weâ€™re anxious.' - Matty Healy

techs.name: Smart Materials
techs.quote: 'For a smart material to be able to send out a more complex signal it needs to be nonlinear. If you hit a tuning fork twice as hard it will ring twice as loud but still at the same frequency. That's a linear response. If you hit a person twice as hard they're unlikely just to shout twice as loud. That property lets you learn more about the person than the tuning fork.' - Neil Gershenfeld

techs.name: Energy Theory
techs.quote: 'Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.' - Roy T. Bennett

techs.name: Hyperstructures
techs.quote: 'The struggle itself towards the heights is enough to fill a man's heart.' - Albert Camus

techs.name: Homo Superior
techs.quote: 'What's with these guys? It's like one of my Japanese animes!' - Otacon, Metal Gear Solid

techs.name: Computronium
techs.quote: 'AI has by now succeeded in doing essentially everything that requires â€˜thinkingâ€™ but has failed to do most of what people and animals do â€˜without thinkingâ€™â€”that, somehow, is much harder!' - Donald Knuth

techs.name: Space Colonization
techs.quote: 'In bewilderment then he almost stopped - /nIn what cold clockwork of the stars and the nations /nWas he the hand pointing that second?' Ted Hughes, Bayonet Charge

techs.name: Future Tech
uniques: Comment [Who knows what the future holds?]
techs.quote: 'I think we agree, the past is over.' - George W. Bush
